resources.string: Application was developed by Vilnius University students of Mathematics and Informatics faculty:
This modern weather station is operated by Vilnius University. Station equipment is manufactured by Coastal Environmental Systems and Kipp & Zonen.
Address:\nM. K. Čiurlionio st. 21/27, Vilnius, LT 03101
Click here to see latest weather report
Weather forecast provided by meteo.lt. Updated:

(In Alphabetical Order)
Indrė Cibulskaitė - Style
Martynas Raila - Programming
Paulius Taujanskas - Lead Programming
 
Laimonas Januška - Scientific Worker
Simonas Kareiva - Executive Lecturer
Live data from Vilnius University. Updated:
Special thanks to: Laimonas Januška and Simonas Kareiva

Temperature - indicator describing the warmth of the air mass this is the most perceptible meteorological indicator for human body. Air temperature is measured in 2 m. height, sensor is placed in a special cage, shielding thermometer from direct sunlight, wind and precipitation.

Relative humidity - the ratio between the mass of water steam in the air and maximum steam quantity in that . The higher the temperature, the more water steam can be in the air. As temperature rises the air becomes drier, when the temperature is falling - a relative humidity of the water rises, until the air becomes saturated water steam (> 98%) - if temperature keeps falling down, water steam in the air begins to condensate the mass - this produces a mist (near the ground) and the clouds (in the higher layers of the atmosphere). Humidity and temperature sensors are integrated 2 m. above the ground.

Atmosferos slėgis – tai oro masės stulpo, esančio virš vietovės, svoris. Vidutinis atmosferos slėgis jūros lygyje yra 1013,25 hPa, tai reiškia, kad oras paviršių spaudžia 1,013kg/cm^2 jėga. Dėl slėgių skirtumų erdvėje kyla oro masių judėjimas žemės paviršiaus atžvilgiu, dar vadinamas vėju. Taip pat tam tikrus reiškinius galima atpažinti pagal slėgio kitimą, pvz.: artėjant ciklonui, kuris dažniausiai atneša lietų, debesis, stiprų vėją; šilumą žiemą ir vėsų orą vasarą – slėgis sparčiai krinta, o artėjant anticiklonui, kuris dažniausiai atneša ramų, be debesų orą; žiemą atneša šaltį, o vasarą - šilumą – slėgis sparčiai kyla.
Rainfall during the day - amount of percipation from midnight, showing how thick is the water layer on one square meter of the area.

Wind speed - the distance that a volume f air traveled per unit of time, usually expressed in meters per second. Wind speed in VU MS is measured by acoustic anemometer which is located 10 meters above the ground.
Wind direction – direction from which wind originates.
Wind gust – sudden and strong wind speed increases.
The height of cloud ceiling - the distance between the ground and lower limit of the cloud, it is measured by the laser. The maximum height that VU MS can capture is 7500 m.

Horizontal visibility - also known as the meteorological visibility. It indicates the distance at which an object will merge with the background . Visibility is limited by water steam in the atmosphere, solid particles or by falling precipitation.

Weather conditions - according to the meteorological visibility, precipitation,ambient temperature, as well as their shape and speed weather detector at VU MS can detect the mist, fog, and various precipitations - drizzle, rain, rainstorm or snow and their intensity.
